TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DataPagerField extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IStateManager
Public MustInherit Class DataPagerField Implements IStateManager
public ref class DataPagerField abstract : System::Web::UI::IStateManager

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for data pager field types, which represent a navigation control for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class serves as the base class for all data pager field types. Data pager fields are used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to represent a navigation control.
Use the classes that are derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> to select which type of pager is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The following table lists available data pager field types.
|Pager field type|Description| |----------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField>|Lets users navigate through data pages one page at a time, or to jump to the first or last page.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField>|Lets users select a page by page number.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField>|Lets page developers create a custom paging UI.|
You can derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class to create additional pager field types.
## Examples The following example shows how to use <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> objects to display page navigation controls in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The objects are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField/CS/DataPagerFieldCS.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField/VB/DataPagerFieldVB.aspx#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class is abstract, you cannot create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object directly. This constructor is typically called by the constructor of a derived class to initialize the properties that are defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class.

Docs.summary: Creates a copy of the current object that is derived from .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.CloneFields%2A> method to create a copy of the current object that is derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField>. To create a copy of the current object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method first creates a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CreateField%2A> method. Then it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CopyProperties%2A> method to copy the property values of the current object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string GetQueryStringNavigateUrl(int32 pageNumber) cil managed
Protected Function GetQueryStringNavigateUrl (pageNumber As Integer) As String

Docs.summary: Creates a URL that contains a query string field that has the specified page number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.GetQueryStringNavigateUrl%2A> method is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields to create the target URL for each button of the pager field. The target URL includes a query string field that contains a name/value pair. The name is the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, and the value represents the value of `pageNumber`.

Docs.param: The saved view-state values for the control.
Docs.summary: Restores view-state information that was saved previously.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.LoadViewState%2A> method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method during a previous page request.
This method is primarily used by the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce(v=vs.100)).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnFieldChanged() cil managed
abstract member OnFieldChanged : unit -> unit override this.OnFieldChanged : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method raises an event that indicates that the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object has changed. Changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Visible%2A> property cause this event to be raised. Changes to properties in derived types also raise this event when state changes occur.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When you override in a derived class, call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.

MemberSignature.Value: protected: property bool QueryStringHandled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.QueryStringHandled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the query string field has been evaluated.
Docs.value: if the query string field has been evaluated; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringHandled%2A> property to determine whether the query string field has been evaluated. If <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringHandled%2A> is `false`, the pager field class processes the page number that is contained in the query string field. It also updates the page properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The pager field class uses this property only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringValue%2A> property is not an empty string or `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected ReadOnly Property QueryStringValue As String
protected: property System::String ^ QueryStringValue { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the query string field from the URL of the request.
Docs.value: The value of the query string field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is not an empty string or `null`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control uses the HTTP GET command to navigate through the pages. A query string field that consists of a name/value pair is added to the URL of the page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringValue%2A> property retrieves the value of the query string field from the URL of the request. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringValue%2A> property contains the requested page number.
This property is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields to evaluate the index of the first record for the page of data requested. The page properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control are then updated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If there is no view state associated with the object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method returns `null`.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method is primarily used by control developers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.TrackViewState%2A> method internally sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property to `true` and invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A> method for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.ViewState%2A> object.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected ReadOnly Property ViewState As StateBag
protected: property System::Web::UI::StateBag ^ ViewState { System::Web::UI::StateBag ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information that enables you to save and restore the view state of a object across multiple requests for the same page.
Docs.value: An object that contains the view-state information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A data pager field's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. To preserve values across HTTP requests for the same page, ASP.NET server controls use this property to store the property values. The values are stored in an HTML hidden input element on the page. For more information, see [ASP.NET View State Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/19d2a6ed-9a77-4c7c-a7f5-74dd4b6c3818).
By default, view state is enabled for all server controls, but there are circumstances when you might want to disable it. For more information, see [ASP.NET Performance Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f882bf1b-a009-4312-ac06-74370ffabc0b).
For more information about dictionaries and how to use them, see [Collections and Data Structures](~/docs/standard/collections/index.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Visible { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
